headline: N/A
abstract:
Biochem-Env is a research platform hosted by the EcoSys department from INRA since 2012. 

The platform provides facilities and dedicated services for the biochemical characterization of soils, sediments, and macrofauna, and more generally functional biodiversity. Using robotics, the platform develops high-throughput tools for the biochemical characterization of large sets of samples. The platform focuses its activities on the development of profiles of soil enzymatic activities (e.g., hydrolase activities involved in biogeochemical cycles and oxidasesâ€¦) and biomarkers (terrestrial and benthos macrofauna).
The platform is also involved in the standardization of procedures (AFNOR and ISO). The data produced will be stored and managed in a database, and analyzed using bioinformatic and statistical tools. 
Biochem-Env will provide the following services to research partners:
-Acquisition and characterization of biochemical properties of different matrix (soils, sediments, macrofauna),
-Developments of high throughput protocols,
-Development of referentials and tools for data interpretation,
-Supply of these resources to the scientific community and policy makers,
-Advice, expertise and training.
author: Christian Mougin
name: BIOCHEMENV - The environmental biochemistry for Research
distributionInfo: Commission Regulation (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards interoperability of spatial data sets and services
